clues.text: After this prophet's death in 632, armies spreading his word conquered large parts of the Middle East & North Africa

After the fall of Rome, this eastern branch of the Goths founded a kingdom in Italy led by Theodoric the Great in 493
The largest internal organ, it weighs about 3 pounds & breaks down substances like alcohol
Keepin' busy, this soft, fatty tissue inside your bones makes platelets & oh yeah, billions of new blood cells daily
Most of your digestion doesn't take place in the stomach but rather in this organ that includes the ileum
Also called the hypophysis, this gland is boss level, as its hormones regulate the thyroid & adrenal glands
This filtering organ is on the left side of the abdominal cavity under the diaphragm, or maybe "are under"--some grow more than one
The name of this Narnia character is a Turkish word for "lion"

In this poet's "The Second Coming", "a shape with lion body and the head of a man... slouches towards Bethlehem to be born"

spelling please; it's just one letter different

Superman,
to Goethe & Nietzsche

hence the last name of cultural critic Susan

Port at the end of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline that was explored & named by Spaniards

Aaron, or the trilling sound a Scot might make when pronouncing the Rs in his name
This word commonly precedes expectancy, insurance & jacket
A female deer, or an adjective describing her rear legs

This developer of the steam engine also invented steam heating as a way to heat his office

It was about the time of the Civil War that he introduced his cylinder lock
Her last words to Samson were "The Philistines be upon thee, Samson"

clues.text: Add 2 letters to "real estate" & you'll get the name of this category about fictional settings

10-letter rhyming name of a catch-all category that's the same as POTPOURRI

A 1974 assassination attempt on this S. Korean president killed his wife instead
First name of the dauphin who was restored to the throne of France with the help of Joan of Arc

The Chateau de Chambord has 1 of these with twin spirals so 1 person can go up & 1 can go down without meeting

rounds.text: President of the Continental Congress 1775-77, he was reelected in 1785 but didn't serve due to illness
